value.title: How awards, recognition decrease inventors' creativity
value.excerpt: The U.S. Fear of failure the second time around Markus Baer, professor of organizational behavior at Olin, and Dirk Deichmann, of the Rotterdam School of Management in the Netherlands, discovered that recognizing first-time producers of successful novel ideas with an award or recognition can significantly decrease the likelihood that they will produce future creative work.
